metadata.title: CVE-2016-9580 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
An integer overflow vulnerability was found in tiftoimage function inopenjpeg 2.1.2, resulting in heap buffer overflow.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9580` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libopenjp2-7 - 2.4.0-6
libopenjp2-tools - 2.4.0-6
libopenjp3d-tools - 2.4.0-6
libopenjp3d7 - 2.4.0-6
libopenjpip-dec-server - 2.4.0-6
libopenjpip-server - 2.4.0-6
libopenjpip-viewer - 2.4.0-6
libopenjpip7 - 2.4.0-6
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openjpeg2 package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.4.0-6').
